pull.title: doc: Remove mention of pulltester from README.md
pull.body: We've switched to Travis CI a long time ago.

repo.name: bitcoin
repo.description: Laanwj's Bitcoin Core fork - see README.md on "readme" branch

events.body:
ACK

On Thursday, November 12, 2015, Jonas Schnelli notifications@github.com
wrote:

> ACK.
> 
> â€”
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/6998#issuecomment-156088558.

Another section from README.md we could consider removing, or adapting, is "Manual Quality Assurance (QA) Testing".
It refers to https://github.com/bitcoin/QA/, which hasn't been updated since 2013, and doesn't seem like it describes how things are actually going (maybe they should, I don't know, but it doesn't help pointing to procedure if no one follows it anyway, willl just confuse new developers).

> It refers to https://github.com/bitcoin/QA/

It can just be removed because we have rpc test now to write exact test plans. Or, maybe condense this down into three sentences: Test plans may be posted to GitHub comments on each PR, etc. But it's not necessary to do a huge write up.

events.message:
doc: Remove mention of pulltester from README.md

We've switched to Travis CI a long time ago.
